text: The 10th District of the Wisconsin Senate is located in Western Wisconsin, and is composed of parts of Burnett, Polk, St. Croix, Pierce and Dunn Counties.District Map ==Current elected officials== Patty Schachtner was elected to the District 10 senate seat in a special election on January 16, 2018. She also currently serves as the St. Croix County Medical Examiner and as a member of the Somerset School Board. Schachtner is also a former member of the Star Prairie Town Board. The special election was to replace the previous senator, Sheila Harsdorf, who was appointed to serve as Wisconsin's agriculture secretary in November 2017. The area of the 10th senate district contains three State Assembly districts:District Map * The 28th (represented by Adam Jarchow) * The 29th (represented by John Murtha) * The 30th (represented by Dean Knudson) The southern part of the 10th senate district is located within Wisconsin's 3rd congressional district, which is represented by U.S. Representative Ron Kind.Congressional District Map The northern part of the district is located within Wisconsin's 7th congressional district, represented by U.S. Representative Sean Duffy.Congressional District Map ==Past senators== The district has previously been represented by:Wisconsin Blue Book, 1991-92 edition, Statistics: History, pages 657-666. * Sheila Harsdorf (R), from 2001 to 2017 (resigned) * Alice Clausing (D), from 1993 to 2001 * William Berndt (R), from 1989 to 1993 * Richard Shoemaker (D), 1989 (resigned) * James Harsdorf (R), from 1981 to 1989 * Michele Radosevich (D), from 1977 to 1981 * Robert P. Knowles (R), from 1955 to 1975 * Warren P. Knowles (R), from 1941 to 1955 * Kenneth S. White (R), from 1937 to 1941 * Walter Hunt (R), from 1925 to 193? * George B. Skogmo (R), from 1913 to 1925 * Walter C. Owen, from 1907 to 1912 * James A. Frear, from 1905 to 1907 * Orville W. Mosher, from 1901 to 1905 * Dempster Woodworth, from 1894 to 1901 * William Henry Phipps (R), from 1891 to 1893 * John Lins, from 1885 to 1887 * Henry M. Ackley (D), from 1882 to 1883 * Richard Weaver (D), from 1880 to 1881 * John A. Rice (D), from 1870 to 1871, 1874 to 1875 * Curtis Mann, 1868–1869 * Marvin H. Bovee (D), 1853 * Judson Prentice (Whig), 1852 * James Giddings (D), from 1850 to 1851 Note: the boundaries of districts have changed repeatedly over history. Previous politicians of a specific numbered district have represented a completely different geographic area, due to redistricting. ==Notes== ==External links== *10th Senate District, Senator Leibham in the Wisconsin Blue Book (2005–2006) *Senator Sheila Harsdorf official campaign site Category:Wisconsin State Senate districts Category:Burnett County, Wisconsin Category:Polk County, Wisconsin Category:Dunn County, Wisconsin Category:St. Croix County, Wisconsin Category:Pierce County, Wisconsin
title: Wisconsin Senate, District 10
